free: #e When you come here, I hope that you can at least stay overnight at times.
#c 你來這裡，至少也在這裡過一夜。
#n T 和M 是親戚，M 經常來台北出差，T的意思是既然常來，怎麼樣也至少去他家坐坐。
#e Moreover, so much work... I cannot do so as I wish; so much work in TapangU.
#c 而且有很多工作...我不能照我想的...達邦有很多工作。
#e Let's see...if (I) have a little time, (I) can stay overnight and look around (Taipei).
#c 這個嘛... 如果我有一點時間我就可以過夜在台北到處看看。
#e When I arrive here, I feel surprised at people in Taipei.
#c 當我來到這裡，台北的人讓我很驚訝。
#n eatatapihu '在台北的人'是定型化片語名詞，構詞為 ea-ta-taipahu 在-斜格-台北
#e Right. There are many people here.
#e On that morning I took an airplane.
#e Although I left very early, I felt amazed that there are a lot of people there.
#c 雖然很早，我很驚訝怎麼那麼多人。
#e The very large airplane on that morning was almost full.
#c 早上那個很大的飛機幾乎坐滿。
#e The teacher said it seems that there're quite a lot of people on the airplane today.
#c 台大的教授說今天的飛機似乎人很多。
#n Teacher here refers to a professor at NTU.
#e I also said, this is really...
#e When I came here last time, there were not so many like this.
#c 我上次來這裡沒有這麼多人。
#e My seat has been reserved in advance by the people here.
#c 啊...那是事先... 這裡的人是先幫我預定了位置。
#e Therefore I will not be afraid of being without a seat when I go back and forth.
#c 因此我來回坐不怕沒有位置。
#n 此IU開頭有 'a isi [EVI AUX.NAF] 應較完整。
#n 此IU開頭有 'a isi [EVI AUX.NAF] 應較完整。
#e My seat for going home in the evening has already been reserved.
#c 我晚上回家的位置已經預定了。
#e The back and forth in one day is really exhausting.
#c 一天之內來回真的非常累。
#e If I cannot (answer the question) they really want to ask about Tsou, it will be a joke.
#c 真是開玩笑如果我不能真的回答他們想問的關於說鄒語的問題。
#n 這句話是由幾個不完整的據子片段拼湊出的，其語意是參酌整體與上下文推論得出的
#e How could it be possible that you can't? If you cannot (do it well), who else can do it?
#c 你怎麼有可能不會？如果連你都不行，還有誰能？

gloss: 照上下文推論應該是一個受焦動詞
free: #n '教'這個動詞常出現的形是ma'cohio (主焦) pa'cohivi(處焦)(Tung 1964:488)
#e There are many people asking questions. The situation is like this: there are many people surrounding me; what they asked is so complicated.
#c 有很多人問我問題。他們問的內容很複雜，問的情況就像這樣很多人圍著我。
#e I try to understandt, at least I am able to answer, that is to clarify what they really want to know.
#c 我試著去瞭解，至少我能去回答，也就是弄清楚他們真的想要知道的。
#e I try my best to answer what they want to ask with my limited knowledge.
#c 我盡我最大的努力，用我稍微知道的一點知識，去回答他們想問我的。
#e They should really understand what you've told them.
#c 他們應該真的知道你所告訴他們的。
#e It's lucky that what they want to ask will be written down in advance, therefore, I can see them in advance when I come here.
#c 很幸運他們要問的都事先寫下來，因此我來這裡的時候可以先看。
